testcase.name: testWrappedObjectFlowTracking
testcase.system-out:
=== Wrapped Object Flow Tracking Test ===
=== Flow Tree === ROOT: Client.allocate [count=2] └── TestHelper.wrapInMessage [ref=1, count=1] └── TestHelper.processWrappedMessage [ref=1, count=1] └── TestHelper.validateWrappedMessage [ref=1, count=1] └── TestHelper.extractFromMessage [ref=1, count=1] └── Client.release [ref=0, count=0]
=== Flat Paths === [count=0] Client.allocate -> TestHelper.wrapInMessage[1] -> TestHelper.processWrappedMessage[1] -> TestHelper.validateWrappedMessage[1] -> TestHelper.extractFromMessage[1] -> Client.release[0]
Tracking Results: wrapInMessage tracked: true processWrappedMessage tracked: true validateWrappedMessage tracked: true extractFromMessage tracked: true
Expected behavior: We should see CONTINUOUS flow from allocate -> release Actual behavior: Flow likely BREAKS when ByteBuf is wrapped in WrappedMessage

testcase.name: testContinuousFlowWithConstructorTracking

=== Continuous Flow with Constructor Tracking Test ===
=== Flow Tree (Continuous) === ROOT: TestClient.allocate [count=2] └── TestHelper.prepareMessage [ref=1, count=1] └── TrackedMessage.<init> [ref=1, count=1] └── TestHelper.processTrackedMessage [ref=1, count=1] └── TestHelper.validateTrackedMessage [ref=1, count=1] └── TestClient.cleanup [ref=0, count=0]
=== Flat Paths === [count=0] TestClient.allocate -> TestHelper.prepareMessage[1] -> TrackedMessage.<init>[1] -> TestHelper.processTrackedMessage[1] -> TestHelper.validateTrackedMessage[1] -> TestClient.cleanup[0]
=== Summary === === ByteBuf Flow Summary === Total Root Methods: 1 Total Traversals: 2 Unique Paths: 1 Leak Paths: 0 Leak Percentage: 0.00%
✓ Continuous flow verified: ByteBuf -> method -> constructor -> method -> cleanup
